head.title: Nader the Green: Is He a Spoiler?

hedline.hl1: Nader the Green: Is He a Spoiler?

abstract.p: Prof Alfred E Kahn letter comments on June 23 article on presidential candidacy of consumer advocate Ralph Nader and threat it poses to that of Vice Pres Al Gore (S)

block.p: You report (news article, June 23) about the threat that Ralph Nader's presidential candidacy poses to Vice President Al Gore's chances of election.

Now that Mr. Nader has the Green Party nomination he sought (news article, June 26), I trust that some reporter will ask him how comfortable he feels about the strong possibility that his candidacy will determine whether it will be Mr. Gore or Gov. George W. Bush of Texas who makes the next several appointments to the Supreme Court, where many cases are decided by the narrowest of margins.

Now that Mr. Nader has the Green Party nomination he sought (news article, June 26), I trust that some reporter will ask him how comfortable he feels about the strong possibility that his candidacy will determine whether it will be Mr. Gore or Gov. George W. Bush of Texas who makes the next several appointments to the Supreme Court, where many cases are decided by the narrowest of margins.
For example, before Gary Graham was executed in Texas, the Supreme Court declined to review his case by a vote of 5 to 4.
ALFRED E. KAHN Ithaca, N.Y., June 28, 2000
The writer is professor emeritus of political economy at Cornell University.
